org.drupal.project.computing

Class DDrush

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drupal.project.computing.DDrush

extends java.lang.Object
    This is the utility class to run drush command.

      • DDrush

        public DDrush(java.lang.String drushCommand,
      java.lang.String drushSiteAlias)
        This is the only initialization code. Need to specify drush command and siteAlias. Default site alias is @self.
        Parameters:
        drushCommand - drush executable command
        drushSiteAlias - drush site alias

    • Method Detail

      • loadDefault

        public static DDrush loadDefault()

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute(java.lang.String[] command,
                       java.lang.String input)
                         throws DSiteException
        Execute Drush command, and returns STDOUT results. attention: here we use shell stdout to output results, which is problematic. possible problems are: 1) security concerns, where confidential info might get printed 2) encoding/decoding characters to byte streams, especially with non-english languages and serializd strings. 3) escaping problems 4) output might get messed up with other sub-processes. some other IPC approaches: 1) Apache Camel, 2) /tmp files, 3) message queue however, STDOUT is the simplest approach for now.
        Parameters:
        command - The drush command to execute, ignoring drush binary and site alias.
        input - Input stream, could be null.
        Returns:
        STDOUT results.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

        See Also:
        "drush core-status"

      • computingEval

        public java.lang.String computingEval(java.lang.String phpCode)
                               throws DSiteException

        Run any drupal code and get returns results in json.

        You wouldn't want to eval any Drupal code here. For example, node_save($node) is very hard to eval because it's hard to pass in the parameter $node.

        To do node_save(), you need a Drupal function as a proxy that takes into some primitive parameters, and then prepares $node to do node_save(). In fact, the basic idea of the "computing" module is that you have a mixed of Drupal/PHP code and non-PHP code, where the former focuses on Drupal-related stuff, and the latter on non-PHP related stuff.

        Parameters:
        phpCode - Should not use ""
        Returns:
        execution results in JSON.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

      • computingCall

        public java.lang.String computingCall(java.lang.String[] params)
                               throws DSiteException
        Call any Drupal functions and returns results in json.
        Parameters:
        params - First param is the function name; the rest are parameters in json. Callers are responsible to wrap the params in json, but not responsible to escape them as command line args.
        Returns:
        Execution results in JSON.
        Throws:
        DSiteException

      • computingCall

        public java.lang.String computingCall(java.lang.String function,
                             java.lang.Object... funcParams)
                               throws DSiteException
        Utility function to use with the first computingCall().
        Parameters:
        function - the name of the Drupal function to call.
        funcParams - the parameters not encoded in JSON.
        Returns:
        Excution results in JSON.
        Throws:
        DSiteException
